DOC.brief_summary: The investigators hypothesis in this study is that administration of rectal and sublingual misoprostol decreases intrapartum and postpartum haemorrhage.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Rectal and Sublingual Misoprostol Administration in Postpartum or Intrapartum Haemorrhage at Elective Caesarean Delivery: a Randomized Controlled Trial
DOC.criteria: 1. live and singleton pregnancy 2. Elective caesarean 3. Gestational week greater than 37 weeks 4. patient between 1844 year old 1. multiple pregnancy 2. Preeclampsia 3. Gestational diabetes 4. Macrosomia 5. Oligohidraamnıos 6. Polihidraamnıos 7. Myoma 8. Morbid obesity 9. Coagulatıon defect (such as HELLP syndrome)
